At Mon, 29 Apr 2013 17:01:22 +0100,
Jackson, Andrew wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> Although I'm up against some internal deadlines for now, I'd be
> interested in collaborating in the future. In particular, it looks
> like Weari distributes the shards across a Hadoop cluster, which is
> something we'll need to consider. Currently, we fire Solr records
> from the reducer to separate, dedicated Solr servers, which scales
> well enough at the moment but may not be sufficient later on. Also,
> I would like to move away from the Heritrix WARC/ARC readers and
> writers to the JWAT ones, so I'll be taking a close look at the JWAT
> implementation before too long too.

Hi Andy,

It sounds like we do the same sort of sharding. We use hadoop for the
preprocessing step of extracting text from (W)ARC files. We might
switch to solrcloud now that it is stable.

best, Erik

--Multipart_Mon_Apr_29_11:25:13_2013-1
